concepts.term: F of open parenthesis w cosine theta, w sine theta close parenthesis

evidence: This is the essence of straight ray tomography and proves the Fourier Slice Theorem.
This is nothing but the general form of the Fourier slice theorem. This is the mathematical derivation.

concepts.term: S theta of w equals F of open parenthesis w cosine theta, w sine theta close parenthesis.
u component is w cosine theta, and the v component is w sine theta.
the general form of the Fourier slice theorem

evidence: S theta of w equals F of open parenthesis w cosine theta, w sine theta close parenthesis.
u component is w cosine theta, and the v component is w sine theta.

concepts.term: w cosine theta, w sine theta

evidence: Then you change the transform back from the t, s system to the x, y coordinate system.

You can express it this way. Rearranging a little, it can be expressed as a two-dimensional Fourier transform, capital F. The u component is w cosine theta, and the v component is w sine theta. Because in the two-dimensional Fourier transform you have x u plus y v, the factor w is redistributed back, giving this relationship.
